title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:00 <abusenius> has quit  
00:00 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
00:08 <+sburjan`> cjdelisle: that mail was automatically created by nexus or did you put those links manually in it ?  
00:09 <cjdelisle> I wrote it myself with the links manually  
00:09 <cjdelisle> still looking for it?  
00:09 <+sburjan`> nop, found it  
00:09 <cjdelisle> k  
00:10 <+sburjan`> but I guess hte installers were also built, right ? the windoze exe and the jar izpack  
00:10 <+sburjan`> I usually test the installer too on final releases  
00:10 <cjdelisle> yup they should be in that list  
00:10 <cjdelisle> and yes they were built special  
00:10 <+sburjan`> yes, found them  
00:11 <+sburjan`> would be nice if we could update the izpack installers (i know it's not a priority)  
00:11 <cjdelisle> thanks a lot  
00:11 <+sburjan`> for what ?  
00:11 <cjdelisle> testing  
00:11 <+sburjan`> it's my job :)  
00:12 <cjdelisle> making 3.1 a great release is mine so thanks for helping.  
00:13 <+sburjan`> ;)  
01:13 <cjdelisle> sburjan`: I found out I will not be available to finish tomorrow so I'll have to finish the release tonight.  
01:13 <cjdelisle> If you already sis prerelease testing that will be enough, it always has been in the past  
01:14 <+sburjan`> the policy is that I also test releases after  
01:15 <+sburjan`> Validation stage  
01:15 <+sburjan`> hope I didn't missed any blockers  
01:16 <+sburjan`> kinda sucks because I am the only tester and If I miss something I'm the only one to blame  
01:16 <cjdelisle> well, everyone has a hand in it so noone is innocent  
01:17 <cjdelisle> hmm alternatively we could hold it until monday and it will really be right  
01:18 <+sburjan`> I don't think vmassol will agree  
01:19 <+sburjan`> I tested pretty much everything  
01:20 <cjdelisle> Well then tonight it is. If it were not for the staging then it would be released now.  
01:20 <+sburjan`> and stay assured, we still have issues :)  
01:20 <cjdelisle> and the staging was a last minute thought  
01:20 <+sburjan`> they never end  
01:20 <cjdelisle> well, it's more about surprises than issues  
01:21 <cjdelisle> aka "surprise: it doesn't start up"  
01:21 <+sburjan`> yepp... those are the most nasty.. because you can't unde a release and you're forced to release a new version if it is a true blocker  
01:21 <+sburjan`> when are you planning to release ?  
01:22 <+sburjan`> how many hours ? :)  
01:23 <cjdelisle> I already did the release process but it's in staging so I can just click a button and publicise it.  
01:24 <cjdelisle> I can start by doing the release notes and getting the blog post ready then publish it and push to ow2  
01:24 <+sburjan`> if yuou wait 10 more hours is too late ?  
01:25 <+sburjan`> I want to test tomorrow morning first hour the packages (installers)  
01:26 <cjdelisle> I'm going to be unavailable tomorrow after 8 our time... which is about 2:00PM yours...  
01:26 <+sburjan`> I'll be long finished by that time  
01:26 <+sburjan`> so it's good  
01:27 <cjdelisle> It doesn't leave me much time to finish publicising the release but it might work  
01:27 <@sdumitriu> Hey Spazholio  
01:27 <+sburjan`> you can start the release notes  
01:27 <cjdelisle> I have  
01:27 <+sburjan`> while I will test  
01:27 <@sdumitriu> Sorry for the delay, github was readonly for a while  
01:28 <@sdumitriu> I just committed the fix  
01:29 <@sdumitriu> The updated jar will be available once this build finishes: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform-3.1/31/  
01:31 <Spazholio> No worries.  And thanks.  
02:02 <abusenius> has quit  
02:09 <@sdumitriu> Spazholio: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform-3.1/31/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-watchlist-api/artifact/org.xwiki.platform/xwiki-platform-watchlist-api/3.1-20110616.232651-146/xwiki-platform-watchlist-api-3.1-20110616.232651-146.jar

09:03 <vmassol> sburjan: they said they're doing it asap  
09:03 <+sburjan> cool:)

09:03 <vmassol> that was on the 13th  
09:04 <+sburjan> I thought you forgot :P  
09:04 <+sburjan> cjdelisle: I'm in position, starting the installer tests

10:30 <vmassol> hmmm why are there 173 modified docs in the last watchlist email  
10:30 <vmassol> ?  
10:30 <vmassol> someone imported a XAR?  
10:31 <+tmortagne> you would see that in the documents logs  
10:31 <vmassol> seems to be on xeclipse only  
10:31 <vmassol> hmm xeclipse.xwiki.org is not accessible anymore for me  
10:32 <+tmortagne> that's weird the mail says " 173 documents have been modified " but I don't have them  
10:32 <+tmortagne> doe sit mean it's 173 document saved without any modification ?  
10:32 <vmassol> I can't check since xeclipse.xwiki.org is not avail  
10:32 <+tmortagne> (don't have them in the mail)  
10:32 <vmassol> seems the descriptor is not there anymore  
10:32 <vmassol> I have them in the mail tmortagne  
10:32 <+tmortagne> I have the list on the right toc  
10:32 <+tmortagne> but that's all  
10:33 <+tmortagne> I don't have any diff  
10:33 <vmassol> I have the diff  
10:33 <vmassol> must be your mail client  
10:33 <+tmortagne> gmail ?  
10:33 <+sburjan> ok, seems we have an issue with the Windows installer.  
10:33 <vmassol> I'm using gmail too but accessing from imap with mail.app  
10:34 <vmassol> let me check online  
10:34 <+tmortagne> if our watchlist mail does not work with gmail it's a pretty serious bug...  
10:34 <vmassol> tmortagne: the message is clipped  
10:34 <vmassol> just click the link  
10:34 <+tmortagne> no it's ok  
10:34 <+tmortagne> just seen the link  
10:34 <vmassol> [Message clipped]  https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/?ui=2&ik=9eccb488eb&view=lg&msg=1309cb3d3c7ba7ae  
10:34 <+tmortagne> yep  
10:34 <+tmortagne> not very obvious  
10:34 <cjdelisle> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <+tmortagne> did not even looked at first seing that as part of the mail footer  
10:35 <+tmortagne> it should display a button or something  
10:35 <+tmortagne> this looks like an import  
10:35 <+sburjan> cjdelisle: don't release yet  
10:35 <+tmortagne> there is only standard XE pages in the list  
10:36 <+tmortagne> except for the other wikis of course  
10:37 <+sburjan> ok. Jar on linux doesn't work either  
10:37 <+sburjan> let me test the zip  
10:37 <+tmortagne> sburjan: you mean the jar installer ?  
10:38 <@sdumitriu> Flushed cache, now xeclipse.xwiki.org is available  
10:38 <+sburjan> tmortagne: jar installer and exe installers don't work. I got a hibernate mapping issue in stack trace  
10:38 <+sburjan> now downloading zip  
10:38 <+tmortagne> ok  
10:38 <+tmortagne> pretty blocker indeed  
10:38 <+sburjan> yepp.. as blocker as you can get :)  
10:39 <+tmortagne> better report it in the mail than here btw  
10:39 <vmassol> indeed xar import: http://xeclipse.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AnnotationCode/AnnotationClass?viewer=history&showminor=true  
10:39 <+tmortagne> since cjdelisle sent a mail asking for tests  
10:39 <vmassol> so someone imported a xar on xeclipse yesterday  
10:39 <vmassol> now how do we find out who did it?  
10:39 <+sburjan> ok, I'll reply to the mail.  
10:40 <@sdumitriu> Admin/admin was active  
10:40 <vmassol> what?????  
10:40 <@sdumitriu> Changing password  
10:40 <+sburjan> should I include a stacktrace in the mail ? or use pastebine, or no stack trace in the mail  
10:40 <vmassol> because of the import?  
10:40 <vmassol> not before  
10:40 <@sdumitriu> No idea  
10:40 <+tmortagne> vmassol: don't think there is any way if it's imported as backup pack  
10:40 <@sdumitriu> Was admin in the import list?  
10:40 <vmassol> checking  
10:40 <+tmortagne> or not hope the one how did the import did some action before of after the import  
10:41 <vmassol> hmm it's not  
10:41 <vmassol> should we ask for a DB rollback from yesterday for the exclipse db?  
10:42 <@sdumitriu> Yep, sounds simpler and safer  
10:42 <vmassol> ok asking  
10:42 <+tmortagne> looks like the one who did the import known what he was doing  
10:42 <@sdumitriu> Admin doesn't seem to be imported  
10:42 <+tmortagne> since the hope page is not broken and you sau Admin is not imported  
10:42 <+tmortagne> we should wait before revarting  
10:43 <+tmortagne> i'm sure it's someone "valid" who did it  
10:43 <+tmortagne> s/hope page/home page/  
10:45 <+tmortagne> activity stream does not seems to work on this wiki  
10:46 <@sdumitriu> Needs PR  
10:46 <@sdumitriu> I'll save it  
10:47 <+sburjan> tmortagne, vmassol, sdumitriu, cjdelisle : sent mail on dev list  
10:47 <+tmortagne> how can we see more in the activity stream ?  
10:47 <@sdumitriu> Fix XE-748  
10:47 <+tmortagne> using AllDocs sorted by date  
10:48 <vmassol> tmortagne: if you edit the macro you can specify how many entries you want I think  
10:48 <vmassol> then click on "preview" ;)  
10:50 <vmassol> sdumitriu: why not remove the Admin user instead of changing pwd?  
10:51 <vmassol> glurps  
10:51 <+tmortagne> the xar used to do the import is not in http://xeclipse.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/import/XWiki/Import?editor=globaladmin&section=Import  
10:51 <vmassol> admin user on xoffice too  
10:51 <vmassol> tmortagne: that's normal  
10:51 <vmassol> if that page was imported  
10:51 <vmassol> did yu check?  
10:52 <+tmortagne> there is xars on that page  
10:52 <+tmortagne> so no it's not because of that  
10:52 <+tmortagne> and I think the page where xar actually are located is not part of the standard xar  
10:52 <vmassol> admin user removed for xoffice  
10:53 <+tmortagne> but don't remember what is the page  
10:53 <+tmortagne> is it http://xeclipse.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Import ?  
10:54 <+tmortagne> yep looks like it's the one  
10:55 <+tmortagne> so the xar used to import has not been attached on this page  
10:55 <+tmortagne> unless an old one has been reused  
10:55 <+tmortagne> there is a 2.6 and a 2.3  
10:56 <+tmortagne> probably the 2.6 so no way to know who used it by attachment modification  
10:57 <+tmortagne> btw the 2.6 one actually don't have some pages which seems to be the page not imported  
10:58 <+tmortagne> so for the theory in which the guy known what he was doing...  
10:59 <vmassol> we really need to remove that Admin user from the default XAR  
10:59 <vmassol> it's too much a security risk  
10:59 <+tmortagne> we need to remove any data from the xar...  
11:00 <+sburjan> importing was always problematic and with surprises  
11:01 <+tmortagne> sburjan: did you have the issue with zip package too ?  
11:01 <+sburjan> tmortagne: yes, I've replied on the list  
11:01 <+sburjan> no no.. the zip is ok  
11:01 <+tmortagne> ok  
11:01 <+sburjan> only jar and exe  
11:02 <vmassol> tmortagne: my guess is that the installers have started failing when I did the removal of the web standard distrib  
11:02 <vmassol> we don't have any tests for them  
11:02 <+tmortagne> so someone refactored the zip and forgot about the jar  
11:02 <+sburjan> and exe :P  
11:02 <+tmortagne> exe reuse the jar  
11:03 <+tmortagne> exe is actually just checking if java is inatalled and then execute the jar  
11:03 <vmassol> they're missing config data probably  
11:03 <+tmortagne> yes  
11:03 <+sburjan> need a full stack trace ? didn't wanted to spam the list with full stack  
11:03 <vmassol> no  
11:03 <vmassol> not needed  
11:03 <+sburjan> ok  
11:03 <+tmortagne> the main issue is that there is way too much duplication between jar and zip packages  
11:03 <+tmortagne> jar package iss redoing pretty much everything  
11:04 <vmassol> node1 on myxwiki, spam on notifications, xeclipse.xwiki.org, installers  
11:04 <+tmortagne> i'm looking at installer  
11:04 <vmassol> ok thanks, I'll look at node1 then  
11:05 <vmassol> what do we do for xeclipse?  
11:06 <+tmortagne> I would like to wait and have a confirmation from all people haveing admin right on this wiki in case they did not look at here before reverting  
11:06 <+tmortagne> fmancinelli, Enygma ?  
11:07 <+tmortagne> there is not much admins willing to take time on this wiki ;)  
11:08 <+tmortagne> asking in PM  
11:08 <vmassol> removing crontab on node1 for now  
11:09 <+tmortagne> waiting for answers  
11:09 <vmassol> sdumitriu: you didn't diable node1 it seems  
11:09 <vmassol> doing it  
11:10 <vmassol> done  
11:10 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: No, it was responding well just then  
11:11 <vmassol> ok  
11:39 <+tmortagne> sburjan, cjdelisle: XE-958  
11:40 <+sburjan> tmortagne: I see  
11:41 <+tmortagne> trying to find why now  
11:45 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:01 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
12:04 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: how did you build XE 3.1 ? Looks like you forgot the -Darguments='-Pci,hsqldb,jetty part since I get the proper result when activating hsqldb profile  
12:06 <@sdumitriu> Could be a bad command  
12:06 <@sdumitriu> Checking the history on agent1  
12:06 <@sdumitriu> Hm, no history  
12:07 <@sdumitriu> He's still logged in, didn't flush his commands to the history  
12:07 <@sdumitriu> And cjdelisle will be away for a while  
12:08 <+sburjan> he will.. be he shouldn't be yet. he said he's gonna be around till 2 PM  
12:08 <+tmortagne> putting this question in the mail then, he will see it when he come back  
12:18 <cjdelisle> howdy  
12:18 <cjdelisle> this one?  
12:18 <cjdelisle> mvn release:perform -DpushChanges=false -DlocalCheckout=true -Pmysql -Darguments='-Pmysql'  
12:19 <cjdelisle> oh no that's manager  
12:19 <cjdelisle> XE:  
12:19 <cjdelisle> mvn release:perform -DpushChanges=false -DlocalCheckout=true -Pci,hsqldb,jetty -DskipTests -Darguments='-Pci,hsqldb,jetty -DskipTests'  
12:22 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: basically installed has not been built with hsqldb profile enabled  
12:22 <+tmortagne> s/installed/installer/  
12:25 <cjdelisle> mvn release:perform -DpushChanges=false -DlocalCheckout=true -Pci,hsqldb,jetty -DskipTests -Darguments='-Pci,hsqldb,jetty -DskipTests' <-- that's incorrect?  
12:26 <+tmortagne> no that seems correct but the result I can see does not seems to have been built with that7  
12:27 <cjdelisle> just disconnected, maybe I did make a mistake, the bash\_history will tell  
12:27 <+tmortagne> I'm trying a build of the whole XE with "mvn clean install -Pci,hsqldb,jetty -DskipTests"  
12:28 <+tmortagne> maybe there is some weird thing happening when building the whole thing instead of just the installer  
12:28 <cjdelisle> just double checked and I followed my guide pretty well  
12:29 <cjdelisle> I wouldn't have been surprised had I pasted the line from manager but it doesn't look like that happened  
12:29 <+tmortagne> nop  
12:29 <+tmortagne> all I can say is that installer is good when hsqldb profile is enabled and to get when we have in 3.1 build I need to build without it  
12:30 <+tmortagne> s/when/what/  
12:30 <+tmortagne> will see what happen with the whole XE build  
12:30 <+tmortagne> running  
12:30 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
12:31 <abusenius> has quit  
12:33 <jvdrean> has quit  
12:34 <vmassol> guys should I ask for a revert for xeclipse.myxwiki.org ?  
12:34 <vmassol> s/myxwiki/xwiki/  
12:39 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: "mvn clean install -Pci,hsqldb,jetty -DskipTests" produce me a proper installer, just tested it  
12:40 <cjdelisle> I used mvn release:prepare -DpushChanges=false -DlocalCheckout=true -DreleaseVersion=$VERSION -DautoVersionSubmodules=true -Pci,hsqldb,mysql,pgsql,derby,jetty,glassfish -Darguments="-N"  
12:40 <+tmortagne> (except for the Gnome integration related bugs of course)  
12:40 <cjdelisle> perhaps that has something to do with it?  
12:41 <+tmortagne> no this is the correct prepare  
12:41 <mpaun> has quit  
12:42 <+tmortagne> and prepare only modify pom versions that should not have any influence on profile used by process anyway  
12:42 <cjdelisle> if you configure your box to release to a staging repo then we could see it happen for real unfortunately I have to get ready to go  
12:44 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: the issue in the installer is that the hsqldb is fully commected, the hsqldb resource plugin did not change and the installer build itself did not change plus it's working with msvn install and on previous release so it can only be a release mistake IMO  
12:45 <+tmortagne> you should check what mvn command is executed when you do your release:process  
12:45 <+tmortagne> maybe you have a typo  
12:52 <+evalica> does anyone know why I cannot comment on a closed JIRA issue anymore? is from a JIRA update or is a rights problem?  
12:53 <+evalica> or maybe is because of the transfer of the issue into Platform - and closing the components projects  
12:58 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: I maybe found something, checking  
12:59 <cjdelisle> you can go ahead and look at the bash\_history, I ran exactly what I had in my notes (a small wonder)  
12:59 <+tmortagne> yep that's it  
12:59 <+tmortagne> there is a maven plugin id issue which makes it take sometime one configuration sometime the other  
12:59 <+tmortagne> fiwing that  
12:59 <+tmortagne> fixing  
13:00 <cjdelisle> would you mind sending some more info about the exact problem/fix to the list? I'm interested but not really available right now  
13:01 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: will put all that in the jira issue  
13:06 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: pushed and explained on the jira issue  
13:06 <+tmortagne> going for lunch now  
13:06 <@sdumitriu> Seems that the right release:perform command line was used  
13:07 <@sdumitriu> Strange  
13:08 <DrLou> has quit  
13:08 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: Did you use mvn3 or mvn2?  
13:09 <@sdumitriu> Ah, the execution id problem...  
13:09 <@sdumitriu> I saw that someplace else, I didn't fix it everywhere

13:28 <vmassol> back from lunch  
13:28 <vmassol> ok very interesting on node1  
13:28 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: yes id problem, we really need to refactor XE so that we don't have to redo things that are already done in the zip package  
13:29 <vmassol> tmortagne: the issue is that node1 doesn't restart, blocked by jgroups  
13:30 <+tmortagne> vmassol: still it has to be stuck before being restarted by the crontab

13:30 <vmassol> understand

13:30 <vmassol> checking

21:47 <asyd> hmm, I just noticed that an anonymouns user can annotate a document  
21:47 <asyd> and I can't see a permission  
21:48 <asyd> (non registered users doesn't have edit permissions)  
21:51 <vmassol> hmm that's strange  
21:51 <vmassol> since annotating means being able to add an object  
21:51 <asyd> well, wiki.opencsi.com  
21:51 <vmassol> so you need edit right for that  
21:52 <vmassol> trying locally  
21:52 <asyd> http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/853/capturedcran20110617215.png/ for permissions  
21:53 <vmassol> just tested and it behaving as expected
